Title: the love car displacement

Penny: Hey. So you guys ready to order?
Okay. So, the usual, with extra spit on Sheldon’s hamburger.
Oh, gee, Amy, I’m sorry, I’m actually pretty busy this weekend.
The what?
Oh. Oh, okay, well, you know, like I said, I have plans, so.
I’m your best friend?
Oh, don’t feel bad. I never read Leonard’s, and I used to sleep with him.
No, I really, I’m sorry, free what? Sorry, what, what?
Wait, wait, just to be clear, when you guys say spa, does that mean the same thing as when regular people say it?
You know, it is going to be difficult, but I’m going to cancel my plans so I can do this for my bestie.
I, I wasn’t going to.
Boy, this is great. I haven’t had a vacation in ages.
You know, for a smart guy, you really seem to have a hard time grasping the concept, don’t piss off the people who handle the things you eat.
Yay!
Brawny?
So, Amy, I’ve been wondering, are you and Sheldon going to be sharing a room?
Hey.
Oh. Thanks.
Terrific. Are we there yet?
Uh, I don’t know. Are you food?
Well, it’s a table, right? I mean, why can’t there be food on it?
Who elected you Road Trip God?
I don’t understand why you people just let him bully you like this. Someone should stand up to him. What’s he going to do?
I can’t believe you let him kick me out of the car.
Should I ask?
Red Leader, I’m really sorry.
You know what? I missed you, too.
Will do.
Um, sure. What do you, what do you got in mind?
Um, I never really thought about it. Why?
Really?
Again, I’ve never given it much thought.
Yeah. Why, what happened?
Oh, yeah, that. Come on in.
We are?
Oh, right, right, the blog.
Hey, can I stay here tonight?
Well, Howard’s a complete and total ass, Bernadette’s in my bed, and no matter how much you stroke Amy’s hair, she bites.
Never mind. Can I stay here or not?
All right.
Well, I’m not getting in bed with him.
We’re just gonna have to make the best of this.
Sleep.
The what?
Oh, okay. Just like old times.
Sweetie, let me put this in a way you’ll understand. From the waist down, my shields are up.
Go to sleep.
We are not having coitus.
Yes.
Leonard, are you asleep?
I really appreciate you letting me stay here tonight.
I know it’s kinda weird.
True dat?
Right. Still mad at me about that?
Thank you.
Good for you.
Good night. You know, maybe it wouldn’t be the worst idea in the world to violate the Neutral Zone for just one night. Oh!
Sheldon: Since we come in every Tuesday night at six o’clock and order the same exact thing, and it’s now six oh eight, I believe your question not only answers itself but also stands alongside such other nonsensical queries as who let the dogs out? and, uh, How are they hanging?
Probably serving food that was ordered today.
In order to take a vacation, one first has to work.
I trust Penny will adhere to the Official California Restaurant Workers’ Solemn Oath of Ethics and Cleanliness.”
You lied to me?

Good morning. If I could have everyone’s attention, please? I know we’re all eager to get on the road to Big Sur, so if we focus, I’m sure we can get through this orientation in under a half an hour. Then it’s just Q&A, quiz, safety drills, pose for commemorative group photo and we’re off.

Raj? What are you doing? I don’t think so. You’ve had your allotted six ounces. The first bathroom break isn’t until the Denny’s located near Bakersfield, which is approximately two and half hours away. Remember, people, we’re only as strong as our weakest bladder.
All right. We have seven people, and two cars. In the lead car, driven by Leonard, will be myself, Amy Farrah Fowler and Penny.
She made the case that if we break down in the middle of nowhere, your Nebraska backwoods skills and brawny hands will give us the best chance to survive in the wild.
Red Leader to Red Five, come in. Red Leader to Red Five, come in. Howard, you promised.
It’s eleven fifteen. I’m requesting your quarter-hourly location update.
Copy that, Red Five. Radio contact is sufficient. No need to extend your middle finger.
Indeed. Nothing sours a friendship more than over-familiarity with someone’s toilet routine.
No. Amy?
No.
Amy, it’s Penny’s turn. Penny?
That’s not apropos. We’ve already established I’m found in the periodic table.
I knew she wasn’t lead car material.
Leonard.
Although Road Trip God does have a certain ring to it.
Please tell me you’re not having coitus.
Can you guarantee that it won’t happen at any time during the night?
(Knock, knock, knock) Raj? (Knock, knock, knock) Raj? (Knock, knock, knock) Raj? I need to sleep here tonight.
Howard is a complete and total ass, Bernadette is in Penny’s bed, Amy bites, and Penny may or may not have coitus with Leonard.

Good morning and welcome to Science and Society. I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper, BS, MS, MA, PhD, and ScD. OMG, right? Perhaps that joke was a little too hippie-dippy for this crowd. All right then, we’ll begin with opening remarks. Miss Rostenkowski, would you like to start us off by discussing your assessment of science’s responsibility to society?
Dr. Koothrappali, would you care to join the conversation?
Excuse me. We’re not taking comments or questions from the audience just yet.
All right, why don’t we see if we can bring this back to topic.
I guess not.
All right, why don’t we open it up to Q&A from the audience?
Must be out of range.
All right, if no one’s going to guess, I was spying the aluminium rims on the police car we passed a few miles back.
Amy: Penny, a moment? Do you have plans this weekend?
That’s too bad. I was hoping you could be my plus-one at the Institute of Interdisciplinary Studies’ symposium on the impact of current scientific research on societal interactions.
Shame. Since you’re my best friend, I thought it would be a good bonding opportunity.
Don’t you read my blog?
Do you know anybody else who would appreciate an all-expense-paid spa weekend at a four-star resort in Big Sur?
Please don’t touch my breasts.
All right. I just want to establish boundaries.
That does seem to be a valid principle.
I don’t believe there’s any such thing.
Yes! He had you in the other car, but I got you upgraded.
No, we discussed it. We decided we didn’t want to jeopardize our relationship by getting to know each other too well.
Don’t worry, Penny. You’re my plus-one. You’ll bunk with me. And FYI, travel makes me constipated, so I’m the ideal hotel roommate.
Are you usually radioactive when found in nature?
Are you in the lanthanoid series?
I missed you.
So, girl talk?
Do you subscribe to the Freudian theory of penis envy?
Sometimes I think it might be nice to have one.
Not for sex, for convenience. You can’t deny that, by comparison, our internal plumbing is extremely high maintenance.
We have time now. Think about it.
Not necessary. Penny and I are perfectly comfortable sharing a bed.
Of course, we’re best friends.
Word of warning, though. I’m prone to night terrors, so if I wake up kicking and screaming, don’t panic. Just pin me down and stroke my hair, and I’ll be fine.
Are we talking about women wanting penises? Because I’d like to weigh in.
Hi, bestie.
Leonard, can I ask you a question?
Are you bothered by the fact that your former girlfriend left the symposium with what is probably the most beautiful man I’ve ever seen in my life?
Because we’re going 120 miles per hour.
Leonard: It’s an annual science conference. We’ve all been invited to speak.
I think her weekend just opened up.
Pretty much. Except we keep our shirts on in the sauna.
Don’t worry. Just sit next to me during the quiz, and you can copy my answers.
They’re bigger than mine.
I can vouch for that.
Not you, him.
Although yours was an eye-opener.
Are you an element in the actinoid series?
It was a late-night vote. We were all exhausted, and he was threatening to filibuster. It’s not technically Road Trip God, it’s Travel Supervisor.
Shh-shh-shh-shh. Sheldon’s asleep. What’s going on?
What?
Uh, sure.
So, how do you wanna do this?
Yeah, it is a little like getting into Dracula’s coffin.
Okay, when you say make the best of it.
Right. So we’ll just call the middle here the Neutral Zone.
Star Trek. You know, the Neutral Zone between the Federation and the Romulan Empire.
Of course, sometimes the Federation and the Romulans would enter the Neutral Zone to negotiate a temporary truce.
Got it, got it. We can do all kinds of stuff from the waist up, you know?
Good night.
No.
No.
Sure, no problem.
True dat.
I’ve gotten a lot more street since we broke up.
No. No, I understand. I got too intense, you had to back off.
I’ve gotten a lot better at that, you know. I’ve dated four different women since we broke up and I didn’t tell any of them that I loved them and wanted to have their babies.
Okay, good night.
Penny’s here. (Raj whispers to him) No, we don’t want to watch Bridget Jones’s Diary!
I’d like to kick your little brown ass.
Oh, I don’t know. Maybe when you walk into a hotel room and you see a guy getting back together with his girlfriend, you should consider doing something other than crawling into the adjoining bed.
No!
Sure.
No. Why do you ask?
Howard (after Raj whispers to him): Nobody cares about your Kegel exercises.
No, it’s not necessarily proportional. Shut up!
Howard (voice): Fine.  Red Five to Red Leader. What do you want now?
Howard: Still right behind you.
Really? You want to see the keynote?
Actually, I was thinking we could go straight to the room and take a nap.
We can watch it later on C-SPAN. Besides, I was really looking forward to you and me napping together in the hotel.
No, see, it’s not…
What could we do? He’s the Travel Supervisor.
Yeah. It’s the Love Car.
Hi. Ow. Hi.
Yes. Bernie sure is.
Hey, Bernie?
Please tell me he’s your gay cousin.
Oh! That’s a relief.
That green bag is Dr. Cooper’s. Here’s an extra five. Make him wait. Oh. Right to the nap, huh? Okay? Uh, so, this Glenn guy. You say you went out with him for, like, a year.
No. I guess not. What is he, like, six-four, six-five?
Probably has a hard time finding a suit that fits.
No. It’s just…
I’m just thinking. If you had sex with that guy, I mean, there’s nothing I can do here that will make any kind of impact.
Yeah, great, love you, too, but, if it were a contest, I wouldn’t have a chance, right?
Yep. Loser.
Sorry. I just never figured that a guy like me going out with a girl like you would ever have to compete with a guy like that.
I’m… I…
No! No, I’m saying exactly the opposite.
Yeah, let’s go with that.

Interesting. I think what you might need to know about my colleague is that though she claims her field of interest  is tiny organisms, she certainly has spent her fair share of time around what we can assume was pretty massive weaponry.
Let me ask you something, Bernie.
How would you feel if you met my ex-girlfriend and she was like Angelina Jolie?
What, I’m not hot enough for Angelina Jolie?
Bernadette: I hope we get there in time to see the keynote address.
Really? And miss the keynote?
Well honey, if you’re that tired, why don’t you just take a nap here in the car?
Hang on. It’s Leonard. Hi, Leonard.
Oh. Thank you, Raj.
Don’t worry, Penny. This is a better car anyway.
Oh, my God, Glenn!
Are you here for the conference?
Oh, good for you. Uh, Glenn, this is my boyfriend Howard.
I’ll try to catch it.
Bye.
Yeah?
No. He was one of my professors in college.
Then we went out for a year. Come on, let’s check in, so we can take that nap.
Do we really need to talk about my old boyfriend now?
Six-seven.
Is something bothering you?
What?
Howard, it’s not a contest. I love you. I want to be with you.
You can’t think that way.
Howard, stop it.
Wait a minute, a girl like me? What’s that mean?
Are you saying you don’t think I’m hot enough to go out with a guy like Glenn?
I’m too hot to go out with a guy like Glenn?
Can I stay here tonight?
Howard’s a complete and total ass.
Thanks. I’ll sleep on the floor.

Sure. I think all branches of science have to move cautiously these days. It’s not just giant nuclear weapons that can destroy the world. As a microbiologist, I can tell you even the tiniest organisms can still tear you a new one.
I think Mr. Wolowitz needs to keep in mind that the past is the past. But he should know that I am the kind of girl who could get all the giant missiles she wants.
Oh, come on, Howard, be realistic.
Um, Penny, that’s Glenn. Glenn, that’s Penny.
Bernadette: Yeah, it sounds fun. Super b: global apocalypse or exciting research opportunity?
Leonard (voice): Yeah, hi. Listen, I just got a text from Raj. He wanted me to tell you that when Howard says nap, he means sex.
Bernadette (singing): They say we’re young and we don’t know, we won’t find out until we grow.
Howard (singing): Well, I don’t know if all that’s true, ’cause you got me, and, baby, I got you.
Together (singing): Babe, mm da-da, da-da, da-da, I got you, babe, da-da, da-da, da-da, I got you, babe…
Glenn: Yeah, I’m doing a global warming panel.
You’re a lucky man. Bernie’s a great gal.
Amy (exiting bathroom): Still nothing. Remind me to try again in an hour.
TV Announcer: Next on Turner Classic Movies, Bridget Jones’s Diary.
Raj: Oh, my God, I’m crying already.
Hey, Leonard, Sheldon kicked me out of the room, gave me your key.
Certainly. I’d like to raise two points. Number one, I think they are talking about penises. And number two, these mimosas are kicking my little brown ass.
I did. You said no Bridget Jones.
I’d like to weigh in here. No.
Penny (voice): We weren’t getting back together! It was a one-time thing!
Yeah, I have a question. Is there anybody who can get me the hell out of here and back to Los Angeles tonight?
Glenn (voice): I’m driving back to L.A. tonight.
Sheldon (voice): Red Leader to Red Five. Red Leader to Red Five. Anybody up for a little game? I spy with my little eye, a nonferrous metal. (Howard throws walkie-talkie out of window)
